message.content:
A harp is a large, stringed musical instrument that is played by plucking the strings with fingers.
It typically has a curved, triangular shape and stands upright on the ground with the neck extending upwards.
A harp is usually made of wood, with strings made of nylon, gut, or metal, and can come in various colors such as natural wood, black or white.
It is a popular instrument in classical music and commonly used in orchestras and in traditional music of various cultures around the world.
Harpists often wear formal attire when performing and sit on a stool or chair while playing.
The instrument can be quite heavy, with some models weighing over 90 lbs.
Harp-making is a highly skilled craft that has been practiced for centuries, with many modern-day craftsmen continuing to create handmade harps of exquisite beauty.
